alert.note: Alert for Floyd; Martin; Pike (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 22 at 8:10PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Martin, northeastern Letcher, east central Perry, Knott, Floyd and Pike Counties through 900 PM EDT... At 810 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Andy to Emmalena. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Warfield, Oppy, Pilgrim, Beauty, Lovely, Coalpoint, Andy, Bradbury, McClure and Preece around 815 PM EDT. Whitepost, Hatfield Station, Rural and Larkslane around 820 PM EDT. Nealy, May, Drew, Omaha, Sackett, Amelia, Hollybush, Isom and Turkey Creek around 825 PM EDT. Democrat, Ivan, Lester, Colson, Polly, Hall, Greenleaf, Tillie, Kite and Dry Creek around 830 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Wheelwright, Deane, Horn, Lucastown, Craftsville, Millstone, Farraday, Winters, Southdown, Sergent, Fleming-Neon, Lowndes, Hemphill, McRoberts, Ehkhorn Mine, Cromona, Baker, Haymond, Potters Fork, Chip, Jenkins, Gaskill, Burdine, Dunham, Payne Gap, Beefhide, Dorton, Myra, Adamson and Shelby Gap. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight EDT for southeastern and northeastern Kentucky.
